sources.title: The Monster Walks
sources.description: Family and servants gather to hear the reading of a will in a spooky old house on a stormy night. Afterward, the household retires for the night, and a plot against the sole heir is hatched. Stars: Rex Lease, Vera Reynolds, Sheldon Lewis, Mischa Auer, Martha Mattox, Sidney Bracey, and Willie Best IMDb Page The 584MB MPEG4 file was derived from the 3.5GB MPEG2 found on this page .

sources.title: The Monster Walks (1932) | Colorized Public Domain Horror Mystery with Rex Lease and Mischa Auer
sources.description:
The Monster Walks (1932) is an early American horror mystery directed by Frank R. Strayer, produced during the pre-Code Hollywood era when studios experimented with suspense, gothic atmosphere, and family melodrama. This restored and colorized edition revitalizes a film often overlooked in the history of 1930s horror, offering a new perspective for modern audiences in the United States, Europe, and worldwide. Combining the haunted-house tradition with the ‚Äúold dark house‚Äù mystery formula, The Monster Walks delivers eerie thrills, secret inheritance plots, and a chilling climax set against stormy backdrops.

Plot Summary:
The story unfolds when the wealthy Herrick family gathers at the remote mansion of the late Dr. Earlton. His daughter Ruth Earlton (Vera Reynolds) inherits the estate, but her arrival with fianc√© Dr. Ted Clayton (Rex Lease) stirs old resentments. Residing in the mansion are Mrs. Emma Earlton (Martha Mattox), Ruth‚Äôs stepmother, and her son Robert Earlton (Sheldon Lewis), a bitter man confined to a wheelchair. Robert resents Ruth‚Äôs inheritance and his mother‚Äôs cold dominance, creating an atmosphere of tension and suspicion.

When a violent storm traps everyone inside the gloomy estate, mysterious noises and unexplained attacks begin. Ruth‚Äôs late father‚Äôs laboratory, filled with experiments and a dangerous ape, becomes central to the mystery. As bodies start to fall, suspicion spreads across the family and staff, including the unsettling butler Hanns Krug (Mischa Auer). Each passing hour reveals darker truths about greed, inheritance, and hidden grudges. The climax exposes betrayal, madness, and a final confrontation that ties together the threads of gothic horror and mystery, making The Monster Walks a key example of early independent horror filmmaking.

Cast and Crew:
‚Ä¢ Director: Frank R. Strayer
‚Ä¢ Producer: Louis Weiss
‚Ä¢ Screenplay: Robert Ellis, based on a story by Charles Logue
‚Ä¢ Cinematography: Edward Linden
‚Ä¢ Editing: Byron Robinson

Starring:
‚Ä¢ Rex Lease as Dr. Ted Clayton
‚Ä¢ Vera Reynolds as Ruth Earlton
‚Ä¢ Sheldon Lewis as Robert Earlton
‚Ä¢ Mischa Auer as Hanns Krug
‚Ä¢ Martha Mattox as Mrs. Emma Earlton
‚Ä¢ Sidney Bracey as Herbert Wilkes
‚Ä¢ Willie Best (credited as Sleep n‚Äô Eat) as Exodus

Film Significance:
The Monster Walks belongs to the wave of early 1930s ‚Äúold dark house‚Äù films that drew inspiration from stage plays and gothic traditions. While not produced by Universal Pictures, it mirrors the eerie atmospheres of Dracula (1931) and The Cat and the Canary (1927). Independent studios like Weiss Brothers capitalized on the public‚Äôs growing fascination with mystery and horror, producing low-budget films with high suspense. Mischa Auer, later famous for his eccentric comedic roles in the late 1930s, here plays a sinister figure, while Willie Best adds an unfortunately stereotyped comic relief performance typical of the era. Though modest in budget, the film reflects the transitional phase of horror cinema as it moved from silent traditions into sound, relying heavily on atmosphere, inheritance intrigue, and storm-lashed settings to create tension.

Enhanced Public Domain Explanation:
This film is in the public domain, which means it is completely free of copyright restrictions and can be legally shared, viewed, studied, and preserved without limitation. Colorized Public Domain restores and enhances these historic works through careful digital cleaning, visual restoration, and colorization techniques. Our mission is to ensure that timeless classics like The Monster Walks remain available to a worldwide audience. By presenting them in color and modern quality, we make them more engaging and accessible to younger generations who might otherwise overlook black-and-white cinema. This process respects the original film while providing a new layer of appreciation for today‚Äôs viewers.

Why Watch This Colorized Edition:
The original 1932 release was in black and white, relying on shadows and candlelit rooms to create suspense. While effective for its time, many contemporary viewers skip over black-and-white films. By offering a colorized edition, we enhance the gothic mansion settings, bring out the stormy night visuals, and give modern audiences an engaging experience while retaining the atmosphere of early horror. This version bridges historical authenticity with modern accessibility.

Subscribe and Explore More Classics:

We upload restored and colorized films from the Golden Age of cinema, from forgotten B-movies to culturally significant classics. Our work ensures these treasures remain discoverable, enjoyable, and preserved for audiences in the USA, Europe, and worldwide.

metadata.Plot: A doctor, who keeps an ape for medical studies, dies and his daughter inherits his estate. Her uncle, a paralytic, working through his natural son by the housekeeper, plans her death, and the ape may or may not be involved. However, the plan does have a problem or two in its execution.
metadata.Actors: Mischa Auer, Martha Mattox, Rex Lease
